properties.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Chuska Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; West Central Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 3:01AM MST until January 22 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...A DISTURBANCE TO BRING SNOW TO PARTS OF NORTH CENTRAL AND
WESTERN NM...

.A storm system will cross the state from the west today through
this evening with rain and snow. Anomalously high moisture
associated with this system will result in a few to several inches
of snow over the northern and west central mountains, as well as
the northwest highlands with near a foot atop mountain peaks. The
snow level will drop to valley bottoms this morning then rise
above 7000 feet this afternoon, and then drop some this evening as
the storm exits to the east.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6
inches, except 1 to 3 inches below 7500 feet, and locally up
to 13 inches on the high peaks of the northern mountains.

* WHERE...Chuska Mountains, West Central Mountains, Tusas
Mountains Including Chama, Jemez Mountains, and the Northern
and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains.

* WHEN...From now to midnight MST Tuesday night.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, particularly along
I-40 at the continental divide, and U.S. Highway 64 through the
Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Tusas Mountains.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means
that periods of snow will primarily cause travel difficulties.
Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT
